story_summary: Rodion Raskolnikov struggled with the implications of his mother's letter regarding his sister Dounia's engagement to Mr. Luzhin. He vehemently opposed the marriage, feeling that it would sacrifice Dounia's dignity for the sake of their family's comfort. As he reflected on their situation, he grew increasingly bitter, contemplating the sacrifices Dounia might make for him and their mother.
